title: Commending Firefighter George Worden upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition after 75 years of dedicated service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Firefighter  George Worden upon the
occasion of his designation for special recognition after  75  years  of
dedicated service to Lomontville Fire Department

WHEREAS,  The firefighters of New York State are renowned throughout the
Nation; their reputation is synonymous with excellence  in  the  arduous
field of fire protection and prevention; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  the  early  days  of "teapot steamers," the volunteer
firefighter has been the cornerstone of our great  Nation's  efforts  to
spare us from the ravages of fire; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body is proud to commend Firefighter George
Worden upon the occasion of  his  designation  for  special  recognition
after 75 years of dedicated service to Lomontville Fire Department; and
  WHEREAS,  Volunteer firefighters and fire departments not only provide
the critical service of fire protection but also engage in other  activ-
ities of great benefit and importance to the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS,  George  Worden,  a  life-long  resident  of  Marbletown, was
honored April 9, 2010 by the Lomontville Fire Department for 75 years of
faithful service to the community as an officer and volunteer firefight-
er; he is still active and attends every weekly meeting and drill; and
  WHEREAS, George Worden helped build the District's first firehouse  in
1935  and  tells  stories  of  inventing makeshift fire equipment in the
early days; he did take a few years off to  go  to  Europe  on  a  troop
transport;  he  and  his  Sherman tank crew entered France in the second
wave on D-Day; and
  WHEREAS, Somewhere between Normandy  and  the  Battle  of  the  Bulge,
George  Worden  had  his  tank  blown out from under him but survived to
serve on into the occupation of Austria; George Worden is now the Presi-
dent of the Fire Company and he still pulls his own weight, pitching  in
at every work detail where he is very much a hands-on guy; and
  WHEREAS, It takes a special dedication, a strong desire to help others
and  a  tireless sense of community to forsake precious time with family
and friends to respond to the signal that a neighbor is in need;  George
Worden  is  such  a firefighter; throughout 75 years of devoted service,
this volunteer heroically performed, above and beyond the call of  duty,
those  responsibilities  which  define the task of fire protection; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That this Legislative Body pause in  its  deliberations  to
commend Firefighter George Worden for 75 years of distinguished service;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to George Worden.
